newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Gresik changes its depreciation policy.
newsitem.headline: Gresik changes its depreciation policy.

text.p: Indonesia's largest cement maker PT Semen Gresik said on Thursday it had changed its depreciation policy, which a company official said might have implications for its 1996 net profit.
"We have revised our depreciation policy to eight years from four years," the official told Reuters.
He said the policy change for its plants was advantageous for its pre-tax level but it would also increase its tax rate.
"Profit before tax is likely to be higher, but the bottom line will also be affected," the official, who asked not to be named, said.
The official declined to give any indication of the company's consolidated 1996 net profit.
"We are still consolidating our results, including those from Semen Tonasa and Semen Padang. The final results will be announce in late March," he said.
In late afternoon trade, Semen Gresik rose 25 rupiah to 6,475 rupiah with about two million shares changing hands.

On Wednesday, many foreign investors unloaded Semen Gresik shares in anticipation of a possible earnings revision due to the changes in its depreciation policy. Its shares dropped 7.5 percent on Wednesday.
